book.intro:
Integrating Learning Objectives Lesson - eLearning Module:

Once you are ready to begin the eLearning module, press the Enter button below to launch the course.

This eLearning module should be completed after Contextualized Learning and Integrated Learning Objectives.

After viewing this course, please continue to Integrating Learning Objectives.

chapter.title: Creating a Brochure for a Fitness Program
chapter.content:
In practical application, contextualization requires teachers to articulate the learning objectives in a variety of skill and content domains for curriculum and instruction. For example, let’s revisit the lesson that we looked at earlier, Create a Brochure for a Fitness Program.

The lesson plan includes three learning objectives (modified slightly from the original), each drawing from different skill and content domains, that we might consider to be: English Language Arts, content/subject learning, and employability skills. Let’s identify them now.

Select the next (arrow) button to continue.

chapter.title: Lesson: Creating a Brochure for a Fitness Program
chapter.content:
Which Objective is it?

In this lesson, you will identify which written objective aligns with which objective topic.


Select the next button to learn more about the Knowledge check.

For each objective, select the corresponding topic, in order to check your knowledge.

chapter.title: Knowledge Check
chapter.content:
On the next screen, you will have the opportunity to match detailed objectives, with their corresponding type.

Please select the button below to proceed.

Click Here to Check Your Knowledge

When you are ready, select the next button or the menu to learn more about each objective and to continue the lesson.

chapter.title: Objective 1: English Language Arts
chapter.content:
Review the objectives from the knowledge check in the right-hand column against the correct objective topic in the left-hand column. 

Objective

Students will write for a specific purpose, using technical, clear, and persuasive language to advertise a free fitness program by creating a sample brochure for the program

Correct Objective Topic

English Language Arts

Press next to review another objective

chapter.title: Objective 2: Subject Learning
chapter.content:
Objective

Students will demonstrate their content learning in health and physical education.

Correct Objective Topic

Subject Learning

Press next to review another objective

chapter.title: Objective 3: Workforce Preparation/Employability Skills
chapter.content:
Objective

Students will demonstrate ability to work collaboratively to create a product; specifically, students will demonstrate applied academic skills, interpersonal skills, and information use skills.

Correct Objective Topic

Workforce Preparation/Employability Skills

If you have reviewed all of the objectives, click the next arrow to continue. If not, go back to review the other objectives.

chapter.title: Integrating Learning Objectives Conclusion
chapter.content:
Lesson: Creating a Brochure for a Fitness Program

Conclusion

This lesson is an example of a contextualized lesson. The lesson provides students an opportunity to learn and practice specific writing (ELA), interpersonal and information use (Workforce Preparation Activities/Employability Skills) and apply them in the context of health and physical education information (subject content).

Select the arrow button to finish this lesson and exit to the Integrating Learning Objectives Lesson page.
